definition: (time) second
second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong
in a matter of seconds/swiftly/rapidly

sentences.english: An airbag that deploys a second later than it should is worse than no airbag at all.
sentences.chinese: 晚一秒钟展开气囊比没有气囊的情况更糟糕。

sentences.english: How to impress the interviewer within 10 seconds?
sentences.chinese: 如何在10秒钟内打动面试官？

sentences.english: Thermite effects changed to look like it is burning for several seconds before causing damage.
sentences.chinese: 铝热效应改变的样子是前几秒钟燃烧造成的损害。

sentences.english: With the Mimosa Large hobo you can switch from a shoulder bag to cross-body in seconds.
sentences.chinese: 随着含羞草大流浪汉可以切换横身在几秒钟内从肩袋。

sentences.english: I count the time you have left me, every minute , every second .
sentences.chinese: 我一分种，一秒钟地计算你离去嘚时间。

sentences.english: The horse cocked its ears up several seconds before I could hear anything.
sentences.chinese: 马把耳朵竖了起来，几秒钟后，我才听到声音。

sentences.english: They propel themselves by using a small fin on their back that flutters up to 35 times per second.
sentences.chinese: 它们靠背上每秒钟扇动达35次的小鳍来推动自己。

sentences.english: The blur is courtesy of a one-second exposure.
sentences.chinese: 模糊是曝光一秒钟的结果。

sentences.english: Hiroshima took nine seconds; Changchun took five months.
sentences.chinese: 广岛用了九秒钟，长春用了五个月。

sentences.english: The end is only seconds away now, and soon all hell will break loose.
sentences.chinese: 现在距离结束只有几秒钟了，马上就要天塌地陷。

sentences.english: Men, women, children - lives snuffed out in a few seconds.
sentences.chinese: 从男人到妇女再到儿童，数秒钟之内就断了气。

sentences.english: So this should be something you can do pretty quickly, so let's take 10 more seconds on that.
sentences.chinese: 你们应该很快就能做出来，再给你们10秒钟。
Twitter用户一秒钟收到信息提醒750次。

sentences.english: Five Second Plan: Kill an enemy in the first 5 seconds after you exit a teleporter.
sentences.chinese: 在你离开传点的5秒钟内，杀死一个敌人。

sentences.english: So, let's do 10 seconds on this problem here.
Stretch slowly and hold the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地拉伸肌肉并保持姿势15到30秒钟。

definition: second (unit of time)/arc second (angular measurement unit)/(coll.) instantly
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
split second
an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
to halt/to break off/pause (in speech)
midnight/to order à la carte/(math.) zero of a function
half hour
Tin Hau, Empress of Heaven, another name for the goddess Matsu 媽祖|妈祖[Ma1 zu3]/Tin Hau (Hong Kong area around the MTR station with same name)
hour/CL:個|个[ge4]
week/CL:個|个[ge4]/day of the week/Sunday
in an instant/in a flash
minute
fully/no less than/as much as/extremely
to press down/to press a button
(in) the original place/the place where one currently is/place of origin/local (product)
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
